page.title: 11LANGUAGE SPOKEN IN GLAMIS
page.content:
The local population, those native to the Glamis area, speak a broad Angus dialect of Lowland Scots. In the school there is still a determined effort made to teach all children to speak "standard" English, though Scots words and phrases are less despised than in previous generations - reflecting a growing pride in being Scottish. This has coincided with a growing influx of English settlers in the area.
A local was heard to say:-
"You can hardly walk the Main Street o' Glamis noo an' hear twa fouk use the guid Scots tongue"
